member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.VssClientEnvironment
member.summary: Provides helper methods to discover the current installation environment for Visual Studio and Team Foundation client bits.
member.remarks: The goal of this class is to encapsulate access to well-known registry keys and application install paths that should be available by default.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.VssClientEnvironment.OpenRootVisualStudioRegistryKey
member.summary: Gets the root registry key of the current Visual Studio registry hive. Whenever possible, using this property is recommended over using Registry.LocalMachine and CurrentVsVersionInformation.RegistryKeyPath. Using the latter limits the portability of our code and is not recommended.

remarks.para: This property returns the registry root for the application. Typically this is HKLM\Software\Microsoft\VisualStudio\<version> but this can change based on any alternate root that the shell was initialized with.
The key that is returned is a read-only key and cannot be modified.
You should close and dispose this key when you are finished using it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.VssClientEnvironment.OpenOrCreateSharedRootUserRegistryKey
member.summary: Gets a registry key that can be used to store user data. Whenever possible, using this property is recommended over using Registry.CurrentUser and CurrentVsVersionInformation.RegistryKeyPath. Using the latter limits the portability of our code and is not recommended. This key points to HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\VSCommon

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.VssClientEnvironment.OpenOrCreateRootUserRegistryKey
member.summary: Gets a registry key that can be used to store user data specific to a version of visual studio . Whenever possible, using this property is recommended over using Registry.CurrentUser and CurrentVsVersionInformation.RegistryKeyPath. Using the latter limits the portability of our code and is not recommended.

remarks.para: The UserRegistryRoot property returns a registry key that can be used to store user data. Typically this key points to HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\VisualStudio\<version>, but an alternate root can be specified when the Visual Studio shell is initialized.
The RegistryKey returned by UserRegistryRoot is the registry root for the current user.
It is opened as read/write. Always call Close on this key when you are finished using it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.VssClientEnvironment.GetVisualStudioApplicationDataPath
member.summary: Returns the path to the client (a.k.a. Visual Studio) user application data folder path.
member.remarks: This will be for the "Roaming" application data folder, which roams with a profile across multiple machines. You might not want to use this folder for big files or machine-specific information.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.ILocationService
member.summary: The service responsible for providing a connection to a Team Foundation Server as well as the locations of other services that are available on it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.ILocationService.GetLocationData(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the provider of location data specified by the given location area guid. The provider could be local or remote depending on where the area data is hosted in the location hierarchy in relation to this service instance. Returns null if the area could not be found

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.ILocationService.GetLocationServiceUrl(System.Guid)
member.summary:
Gets the URL of the location service for the given location area guid and access mapping moniker. If the area could not be found this method will return null. This is useful for getting the base URL of service hosts, or of other service instances or resource areas.
To find a specific service definition contained in the given location area and to formulate the proper URL for a specific resource in that location area, you would need to retrieve the location data for that area. This operation is simplified by calling GetLocationData

The service identifier of the ServiceDefinition to find.
member.returns: The ServiceDefinition with the specified service type and service identifier. If no matching ServiceDefinition exists, null is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.ILocationDataProvider.FindServiceDefinitions(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the ServiceDefinitions for all of the services with the specified service type. If no ServiceDefinitions of this type exist, an empty enumeration will be returned.
member.param: The case-insensitive string that identifies what type of service is being requested. If this value is null, ServiceDefinitions for all services registered with this location service will be returned.
member.returns: ServiceDefinitions for all of the services with the specified service type. If no ServiceDefinitions of this type exist, an empty enumeration will be returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.ILocationDataProvider.LocationForCurrentConnection(System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary:
Returns the location for the ServiceDefintion associated with the ServiceType and ServiceIdentifier that should be used based on the current connection. If a ServiceDefinition with the ServiceType and ServiceIdentifier does not exist then null will be returned. If a ServiceDefinition with the ServiceType and ServiceIdentifier is found then a location will be returned if the ServiceDefinition is well formed (otherwise an exception will be thrown).
When determining what location to return for the ServiceDefinition and current connection the following rules will be applied:
1. Try to find a location for the ClientAccessMapping. 2. Try to find a location for the DefaultAccessMapping. 3. Use the first location in the LocationMappings list.
member.param: The service type of the ServiceDefinition to find the location for.
The service identifier of the ServiceDefinition to find the location for.
member.returns: The location for the ServiceDefinition with the provided service type and identifier that should be used based on the current connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.ILocationDataProvider.LocationForCurrentConnection(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Location.ServiceDefinition)
member.summary:
Returns the location for the ServiceDefintion that should be used based on the current connection. This method will never return null or empty. If it succeeds it will return a targetable location for the provided ServiceDefinition.
When determining what location to return for the ServiceDefinition and current connection the following rules will be applied:
1. Try to find a location for the ClientAccessMapping. 2. Try to find a location for the DefaultAccessMapping. 3. Use the first location in the LocationMappings list.
member.param: The ServiceDefinition to find the location for.
member.returns: The location for the given ServiceDefinition that should be used based on the current connection.

member.summary: Returns the location for the ServiceDefinition that has the specified service type and service identifier for the provided AccessMapping. If this ServiceDefinition is FullyQualified and no LocationMapping exists for this AccessMapping then null will be returned.
member.param: The service type of the ServiceDefinition to find the location for.
The service identifier of the ServiceDefinition to find the location for.
The AccessMapping to find the location for.
member.returns: The location for the ServiceDefinition for the provided AccessMapping. If this ServiceDefinition is FullyQualified and no LocationMapping exists for this AccessMapping then null will be returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.ILocationDataProvider.LocationForAccessMapping(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Location.ServiceDefinition,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Location.AccessMapping)

member.param: The ServiceDefinition to find the location for.

member.returns: The location for the ServiceDefinition for the provided AccessMapping. If this ServiceDefinition is FullyQualified and no LocationMapping exists for this AccessMapping then null will be returned.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.Location.LocationCacheManager.m_cacheExpirationDate
member.summary: The time after which the local cache data is invalid. This is used to prematurely expire the client cache even if we don't know (yet) whether or not the server changed. By expiring the client cache we can ensure that clients will be forced to check for server updates periodically rather than relying on the client cache indefinitely in the degenerate case where no client tools ever explicitly call Connect() (such as tf.exe)

member.summary: Construct a new API Version info from the given version string

Version string in the form: {ApiMajor}.{ApiMinor}[-{stage}[.{resourceVersion}]]

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.ApiResourceVersion.ApiVersion
member.summary: Public API version. This is the version that the public sees and is used for a large group of services (e.g. the TFS 1.0 API)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.ApiResourceVersion.ApiVersionString
member.summary: String representation of the Public API version. This is the version that the public sees and is used for a large group of services (e.g. the TFS 1.0 API)

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.ApiResourceVersion.ResourceVersion
member.summary: Internal resource version. This is defined per-resource and is used to support build-to-build compatibility of API changes within a given (in-preview) public api version. For example, within the TFS 1.0 API release cycle, while it is still in preview, a resource's data structure may be changed. This resource can be versioned such that older clients will still work (requests will be sent to the older version) and new/upgraded clients will talk to the new version of the resource.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.WebApi.VssJsonPatchMediaTypeFormatter
member.summary:
The media type formatter for json-patch. It deserializes the incoming json into a JsonPatchDocument, and then calls PatchDocument.CreateFromJson which creates the strongly typed PatchDocument expected by the controller.
This is done to ensure all semantic validation can occur before the controller gets the object model.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Profile.AttributesScope
member.summary: Used to specify the scope of a set of attributes.
member.remarks: A profile attribute is either a core attribute or an attribute beloging to some application container. A core attribute belongs to scope AttributesScope.Core. An attribute stored under some application container belongs to scope AttributesScope.Application. An attribute always belongs to scope AttributesScope.Core | AttributesScope.Application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Profile.Client.ProfileHttpClient.SetAttributeAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Profile.ProfileAttribute,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Updates (conditionally) the value of a profile attribute if it already exists.
member.remarks: If attribute does not exist then a new attribute is added. If the timestamp in the parameter is not the default value of , then the attribute is only updated if the paramter has a newer timestamp than the attribute stored in the server.
member.exception: If the attribute in the server has a newer timestamp.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Profile.Client.ProfileHttpClient.DeleteAttributeAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Profile.ProfileAttribute,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Deletes (conditionally) a profile attribute.
member.remarks: If the timestamp in the parameter is not the default value of , then the attribute is only deleted if the paramter has a timestamp which is not older than the timestamp of the attribute in the server.
member.exception: If named attribute does not exist on the server.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Profile.Client.ProfileHttpClient.UpdateProfileAsync(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Profile.Profile,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Partially updates the content of a profile by comparing changes with the contents of a given profile in parameter .
member.remarks: A profile property is not updated if the property is set to null in parameter . A profile attribute is not updated if the attribute is missing from the list of attributes in .
member.exception: If the revision in the parameter does not match to the current revision
member.param: The Guid of the Identity with which the Profile is associated. There exists a 1 to 1 mapping between an Identity and a Profile
Container object that contains the changes to be applied to the profile
member.returns: The revision of the updated profile

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Identity.IdentitySearchFilter.General
member.summary: A general search for an identity.
member.remarks:
This is the default search factor for shorter overloads of ReadIdentity, and typically the correct choice for user input.
Use the general search factor to find one or more identities by one of the following properties: * Display name * account name * UniqueName
UniqueName may be easier to type than display name. It can also be used to indicate a single identity when two or more identities share the same display name (e.g. "John Smith")

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes
member.summary: Provides the possible error codes which can result from a bad token exchange in OAuth 2.0.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.AccessDenied
member.summary: The resource owner or authorization server denied the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.InvalidClient
member.summary: Client authentication failed (e.g. unknown client, no client authentication included, or unsupported authentication method).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.InvalidGrant
member.summary: The provided authorization grant is invalid, expired, revoked, or does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.InvalidRequest
member.summary: The request is missing a required parameter.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.InvalidScope
member.summary: The requested scope is invalid, unknown, malformed, or exceeds the scope granted by the resource owner.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.ServerError
member.summary: The authorization server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.TemporarilyUnavailable
member.summary: The authorization server is currently unable to handle the request due to temporary orverloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.UnauthorizedClient
member.summary: The authenticated client is not authorized to use this authorization grant type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.UnsupportedGrantType
member.summary: The authorization grant type is not supported by the authorization server.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.VssOAuthErrorCodes.UnsupportedResponseType
member.summary: The authorization server does not support obtaining access tokens using this method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.OAuth.Client.OAuthHttpClient.HandleResponse(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary:
There are 3 error response kinds: 1. An authorization error with no redirect URL. 2. An authorization error with redirect URL. 3. A token request error.
If the status code is not 302, we will throw an exception with the response body's content read as a string, which contains the specific error code.
http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-4.1.2 http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749#section-5.2

member.summary:
This is a virtual directory that represents the current request context's source directory.
At the deployment level, this directory is equivalent to .
At the application level or below this directory has the following interpretations:
In an on-prem environment, this is equivalent to .
In a hosted environment with an MSA-backed account, this is equivalent to .
In a hosted environment with an AAD-backed account, this is equivalent to .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryName.Any
member.summary: This is a virtual directory that represents any source.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.AadReadFailed
member.summary: Returned when we failed to read AAD objects because we couldn't communicate with AAD or because AAD returned an invalid response, i.e. when AadService.Get(Users/Groups) fails.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.AadReadTypeUnrecognized
member.summary: Returned when the type of entity returned from AAD does not match a known type such as AadUser or AadGroup.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.ConvertFailed
member.summary: Returned when we received a valid response from one backing directory but were unable to convert it to the format required by the target directory. For example, occurs when we cannot convert an AAD user to the corresponding VSD identity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.IdTranslationConflict
member.summary: Returned when we cannot create an identity ID translation because there is a conflict with a preexisting identity in the same account scope.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.IdTranslationLocalIdMismatch
member.summary: Returned when we attempted to create an identity ID translation but the resulting local ID did not match the expected value. Indicates an internal ID translation failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.IdTranslationMasterIdMismatch
member.summary: Returned when we attempted to create an identity ID translation but the resulting master ID did not match the expected value. Indicates an internal ID translation failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.IdTranslationNotAllowed
member.summary: Returned when we attempted to create an identity ID translation for an identity for which ID translation is not allowed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.IdTranslationResultCountMismatch
member.summary: Returned when the number of identities that we expected to translate is not the same as the number that were actually translated. Indicates an internal ID translation failure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.IdTranslationResultNull
member.summary: Returned when an identity read returned null after we attempted to create an identity ID translation, which indicates that the translation was not created successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.InvalidHostType
member.summary: Returned when we are trying to perform an operation on an unsupported host type. For example, AAD operations require an application host or lower and will return this error at the deployment level.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.InvalidLicenseType
member.summary: Returned when the license string passed in by the caller is not a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.InvalidPermissionsProperty
member.summary: Returned when the permissions object passed in by the caller does not match the expected object structure.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.InvalidProfileState
member.summary: Returned when the profile string passed in by the caller is not a .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.InvalidRequestEntity
member.summary: Returned when the request entity passed in by the caller cannot be parsed as some known implementation of IDirectoryEntityDescriptor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.LicenseNotAvailable
member.summary: Returned when no licenses of the requested type are available, such as when the backing account has already used up its quota of purchased licenses.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.LicenseWriteFailed
member.summary: Returned when we failed to assign a license for a reason other than .

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.LocalGroupWriteFailed
member.summary: Returned when we failed to assign a local group membership.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.NoResults
member.summary: Returned when there was no result matching the request parameters across all backing directories.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.NotInScope
member.summary: Returned when the requested entity is not effectively in scope, i.e. does not have an ancestor which is already a member of the account.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.PermissionsNamespaceNotFound
member.summary: Returned when one of the security namespace IDs passed in the permissions property cannot be resolved to a security namespace.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.PermissionsWriteFailed
member.summary: Returned when we failed to set access control entries.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.ProfileWriteFailed
member.summary: Returned when we failed to create a profile.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.ProtectedIdentityConflict
member.summary: Returned when the request properties conflict with but do not exactly match a protected identity, for which an exact match is required.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.ResultCountMismatch
member.summary: Returned when the number of results returned by a directory such as VSD or AAD. does not match the number of request members that we sent to that directory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.ResultMapFailed
member.summary: Returned when we received a result but hit an error when trying to map that result back to the original request entity.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.RootIdentitiesFailed
member.summary: Returned when we cannot root identities to make sure they are visible, even if only as inactive, in the target scope.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.ScopeNotDeterminable
member.summary: Returned when we cannot verify whether the requested entity is effectively in scope.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.Success
member.summary: Returned when the request member was successfully discovered and added to the current scope with the request profile, license, and group memberships.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.TooManyResults
member.summary: Returned when we expected a single result from a backing directory such as VSD or AAD, but we received more than one result. Can occur when performing operations using potentially non-unique keys such as the principal name. Should never occur which using unique keys like the VSID or object ID.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.VsdReadFailed
member.summary: Returned when we failed to read VSD identities because we couldn't communicate with VSD or because VSD returned an invalid response, i.e. when IdentityService.ReadIdentities fails.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Directories.DirectoryStatus.VsdWriteFailed
member.summary: Returned when we failed to write VSD identities because we couldn't communited with VSD or because VSD returned an invalid response i.e. when IdentityService.UpdateIdentities fails.

summary.para: This is a partial view of a known directory entity at a point in time. Two views of the same logical directory entity may contain different properties.
All directory entities implement this read-only interface.
This is an opaque identifier for this directory entity.

If two identifiers are equal, then they reference the same logical directory entity. If entity 1 has identifier "x" and entity 2 has identifier "x", then the entitys are views of the same directory entity.

If two identifiers are not equal, then they may reference different logical directory entitys or the same logical directory entity. In most cases, if entity 1 has identifier "x" and entity 2 has identifier "y", then the entitys are views of different directory entitys. However, in some cases, such as when the format of the identifier changes, then the entitys are views of the same directory entity.
The format of this identifier is subject to change without notice and clients should not attempt to parse it.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Location.ServiceDefinition.GetLocationMapping(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Location.AccessMapping)
member.summary: Returns the LocationMapping for the AccessMapping provided or null if this ServiceDefinition does not have a LocationMapping for the provided AccessMapping. This function will always return null if it is called on a non-relative ServiceDefinition.
member.param: The AccessMapping to find the LocationMapping for.
member.returns: The LocationMapping for the AccessMapping provided or null if this ServiceDefinition does not have a LocationMapping for the provided AccessMapping. This function will always return null if it is called on a non-relative ServiceDefinition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Location.ServiceDefinition.AddLocationMapping(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Location.AccessMapping,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a location mapping for the provided access mapping and location to the service definition. Note that if a mapping already exists for the provided access mapping, it will be overwritten.
member.param: The access mapping this location mapping is for. This access mapping must already be registered in the LocationService. To create a new access mapping, see LocationService.ConfigureAccessMapping

This value must be null if the RelativeToSetting for this ServiceDefinition is something other than FullyQualified. If this ServiceDefinition has a RelativeToSetting of FullyQualified, this value must not be null and should be the location where this service resides for this access mapping.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Security.AceExtendedInformation.InheritedAllow
member.summary: These are the permissions that are inherited for this identity on this token. If the token does not inherit permissions this will be 0. Note that any permissions that have been explicitly set on this token for this identity, or any groups that this identity is a part of, are not included here.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Security.AceExtendedInformation.InheritedDeny
member.summary: These are the permissions that are inherited for this identity on this token. If the token does not inherit permissions this will be 0. Note that any permissions that have been explicitly set on this token for this identity, or any groups that this identity is a part of, are not included here.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Security.AceExtendedInformation.EffectiveAllow
member.summary: This is the combination of all of the explicit and inherited permissions for this identity on this token. These are the permissions used when determining if a given user has permission to perform an action.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Security.AceExtendedInformation.EffectiveDeny
member.summary: This is the combination of all of the explicit and inherited permissions for this identity on this token. These are the permissions used when determining if a given user has permission to perform an action.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Security.SecurityNamespaceDescription
member.summary: Class for describing the details of a TeamFoundationSecurityNamespace.
Creates a SecurityNamespaceDescription which can be used to create a SecurityNamespace
member.param: The id that uniquely identifies the SecurityNamespace.
The non-localized name for the SecurityNamespace that will be used for things like the command-line.
The localized display name for the SecurityNamespace.
This is the dataspace category that describes where the security information for this SecurityNamespace should be stored.

If the security tokens this namespace will be operating on need to be split on certain characters to determine its elements that character should be specified here. If not, this value must be the null character.

If the security tokens this namespace will be operating on need to be split on certain character lengths to determine its elements, that length should be specified here. If not, this value must be -1.
The structure that this SecurityNamespace will use to organize its tokens. If this namespace is hierarchical, either the separatorValue or the elementLength parameter must have a non-default value.
The permission bits needed by a user in order to modify security data in this SecurityNamespace.
The permission bits needed by a user in order to read security data in this SecurityNamespace.
The list of actions that this SecurityNamespace is responsible for securing.

The full type of the class that implements ISecurityNamespaceExtension that will act as a security namespace extension for this security namespace. Null or String.Empty if this security namespace will not have a security namespace extension.
If true, the security namespace is remotable, allowing another service to proxy the namespace.
If true, the security service will expect an ISecurityDataspaceTokenTranslator plugin to exist for this namespace

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Services.Security.SecurityNamespaceDescription.NamespaceId
